title: Creative Thinking Strategies for Unstructured Problem Solving

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of elementary mathematical concepts and experience in job-related problem-solving
context.additional_context: A process for freely generating ideas and solving mathematical problems in a digitally supported environment

learning_goals: Learners can solve unstructured math problems with three or more creative approaches using free association techniques.
Learners can enhance the originality of ideas by over 20% during problem-solving by applying the remote association technique.
Learners can measure the fluency of solutions based on peer feedback in a blended learning environment.

resources: Digital Collaboration Tools (Online Whiteboard, Real-Time Document Editor)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
